changes.change: Fixed Problem in addresses.cpp:402 error (affected mirv_replace_name).

Added mirv_vpanel command for testing. It's probably not useful and thus not planned to stay. An example for it would be
mirv_streams edit streamNameHere attachCommands "mirv_vpanel hide HudZoom"
This will hide the scope overlay of the Hud and leave the other HUD untouched.
Fixed typo in afx/wh.cfg causing the per stream shouldForceNoVisOverride option not to be set to 1.

Added shouldForceNoVisOverride to mirv_streams edit for baseFx based streams (which most are). When set to 1 specifies visibility extension (disabling of visiblity checks) per stream (still not perfect, but okay I guess) and replaces the r_novis console variable method, that would affect all streams and thus could have unwanted side-effects. The afx/wh cfg was updated accordingly, people with custom cfgs might need to add this new setting to their cfgs.

Fixed mirv_streams crashes due to material creation and class variable initialization issues. Moved material initialization onto the main thread, because it seems the CS:GO material system FindMaterial function can crash when called from different threads, especially when called at the same time.
Fixed ripieces/advancedfx#28 : mirv_campath edit start delta+/delta- sub-commands not working correctly.
Fixed mirv_campath edit interp rotation, expecting cubic instead of intended sCubic, thanks to cZF.

changes.change:
Updated AfxHookSource to work with the 17 Feb 2016 CS:GO update.
I called this AfxHookSource lite version, because you won't be able to use matte / depth / alpha streams or actions related to those. It might take quite a while until those features work as good as they did before again, because Valve updated the shaders that HLAE partially hooks with replacement shaders and there is no proper source code available (closest is still the old Alien Swarm SDK) and I don't know yet how complicated their new changes / additions are.

https://www.reddit.com/r/AMDHelp/comments/46d193/counterstrike_global_offensive_operation_wildfire/

changes.change: Added several options to mirv_streams actions add replace.
Added smokeOverlayAlphaFactor to mirv_streams baseFx based streams.

Added easy on-screen wallhack config complete with material and texture files.
This is really easy, just enter the following into console (will print help):
exec afx/wh
This also serves as sample how to use the new features added recently (just have a look at the files in the resources folder).
Fixed mirv_streams actions being case sensitive in some cases (now are fully non-case sensitive again).
Fixed mirv_streams missing invisible action, which can be a problem for users still relaying on it, however it's actually just a noDraw action these days.

Fixed mirv_streams actions like mask/drawDepth/white/... having problems with Sprite_DX9 shader (those actions will fallback to noDraw action for this shader now, should mostly affect light glows etc. only).

release.name: AfxHookSource

changes.change: Added mirv_fov handleZoom, which allows to enable zoom handling for mirv_fov (so it doesn't override the fov when zoomed). For CS:GO you only need to do mirv_fov handleZoom enabled 1. For other mods not using a default 90.0 fov you might need to set the threshold with mirv_fov handleZoom minUnzoomedFov.
Updated mirv_streams heavily to support mirv_streams actions.

Added a mirv_streams actions, which is the ability to add custom actions that can be used as action for baseFx based streams (currently all streams except developer and normal stream). There is currently only on custom action to add, which is the replace action, which allows to define a replacement material for an action. While HLAE does basic checks if the material is compatible with the one replaced, there might still be console errors or even crashes, if the material is not compatible, so use with care.
The replace action basically replaces the material ("texture") of a model, but not the model itself. So pelase don't get too excited!

Added a actionFilter command to mirv_streams baseFx streams. Command has built-in help. It allows to filter by material name (even using wild cards) and set an action for that material. Be careful, for example replacing the vgui materials will mess up your console! (Well it mostly just does what you ask it to.)

Added otherAction to mirv_streams, this will hoepfully improve handling of unknown materials on custom maps for the various stream templates. (Also added a few readonly actions that are of no real use but used internally.)

release.comments:
For custom replacement materials it's a good idea to use the resources\AfxHookSource\assets\csgo\materials folder in the HLAE installation directory, because HLAE mounts the whole resources\AfxHookSource\assets\csgo folder into the game. That way you won't mess up your game. Since the HLAE mounted directory has lowest priority, you need to use a material name that is not already used for your custom materials, meaning the best idea is to place them in a custom sub-directory, i.e. resources\AfxHookSource\assets\csgo\materials\my.
Good luck, have fun, happy testing!

changes.change: Updated mirv_streams: Reduced potential for epileptic seizures upon recording again. (Now only main game view should be shown now, really.)

Added writeZAction in mirv_streams, this allows to properly remove level walls from drawing and blocking the view. Basically you add a alphaMatte and an alphaEntity stream and set for each stream the writeZAction to noDraw (this removes the clip planes from i.e. the level walls) and i.e. the worldTexturesAction, staticPropTexturesAction, otherModelsAction, cableAction, clientEffectTexturesAction, decalTexturesAction, effectsAction, otherParticleAction, errorMaterialAction, weaponModelsAction to noDraw and set the r_novis console variable to 1 (to disable the visbility checks). Also on de_dust2 you might need to use a special depth stream in order to mask what I call the castle in the sky, which is basically a far away version of de_dust2 (doesn't happen on other maps usually, you can use the fact that's it further away than 16384 inches)). We'll try to make a tutorial and link it here: TUTORIAL INK TBA
Exposed errorMaterialAction in mirv_streams.
Updated mirv_streams noDraw action to be more aggressive, it should work on all materials now.
Removed mirv_streams invisible action. It's still accepted as valid input, but will be mapped to noDraw instantly.

Added depthF and depthFZIP capture types to mirv_streams: Those are the preferred capture types for OpenEXR / high precision depth captures now. However they might require a quite recent graphic card in order to work.
Example:
mirv_streams add depth myDepthF
mirv_streams edit myDepthF depthValMax 8192
mirv_streams edit myDepthF captureType depthF
Fixed depth24 action: No alpha blending anymore, that would lead to inaccurate results, (binary) alpha testing instead.
Updated mirv_streams: Reduced potential for epileptic seizures upon recording. (Only main game view should be shown now and it might jump between two succeeding frames a bit.)

release.name: AfxHookSource

changes.change: Fixed huge OpenEXR / depth24 export inaccuracies due to a wrong formular causing huge problems in precision dependant post processing. Please also read the comments at the end of this changelog entry.
Fixed the on-screen drawing of the campath (mirv_campath draw) being off by one frame (hardly noticeable).
Renamed mirv_streams stattrackAction to statTrakAction (old spelling will still be accepted).

release.comments:
Please note: It is highly recommended to turn off in-game Anti Aliasing when using depth24 / OpenEXR support, because several anti aliasing methods used are not neutral to the colour hue.
Also please note, while the export is named depth24, the actual accuracy is 23 bits maximum. Depending on your garphic card and drivers the accuracy can be much lower, however with modern cards and drivers you should be close to the 23 bit maximum accuracy.

changes.change:
Added depth24 (OpenEXR) support to mirv_streams, example commands to add a depth24 stream:
mirv_streams add depth mydepth24
mirv_streams edit mydepth24 depthValMax 8192.0
mirv_streams edit mydepth24 mod toDepth24
If you want to have the OpenEXR files with ZIP compression (probably slower) use toDepth24ZIP instead of toDepth24.
Fixed missing code causing SplineRope based materials to not work properly with mirv_streams anymore.

Fixed mirv_streams affecting the HUD. Currently mirv_streams should not affect the HUD (if working properly). Maybe in future updates we will handle the HUD too with replacement shaders, but not for now.

Added mirv_deathmsg modTime - allows to set a multiplier value for displaytime of a deathmessage, it is smilar to mirv_deathmsg block, except that it takes an additional argument (floating point value) for the multiplier (a negative multiplier value will make it behave like mirv_deathmsg block). The resulting display time for a matched notification is [mirv_deathmsg cfg noticeLifeTime] * [multiplier value].
Fixed problems with AfxHookSource 0.2.8.0.

release.name: AfxHookSource

changes.change: Added mirv_skip, allows to skip approximate demo ticks / demo time (front-end to demo_gototick command).

Updated the mirv_streams system: It's far more accurate in many cases now, because it comes with replacement shaders for SplineRope, SpriteCard, VertexLitGeneric (only non-bumped and non-phong shaders atm) and UnlitGeneric (only non-bumped and non-phong shaders atm) and also uses UnlitGeneric as fallback material shader now. Please note that the installation size increased heavily due to the shaders (196MB increase).

release.comments:
Please note: advancedfx.org recommends using alphaWorld and alphaMatteEntity (alphaMatte + alphaEntity) stream above matteWorld and matteEntity stream, since those are far superior!
TODO: Add OpenEXR support for supporting the new depth24 action (24 bit depth streams export).

changes.change: Fixed render state problems once and for all hopefully (i.e. with D3DRS_SRGBWRITEENABLE state causing i.e. black console): The render state or vertex / pixel shader constants overrides should now be properly transparent to the game (meaning the Get* actions will feed the game with its own original values).
Fixed mirv_streams console warning / error spam about missing afx_* shaders that were not used anyway (unless you had set the hidden testAction to 1).
Fixed and re-added forcing of D3DRS_SRGBWRITEENABLE state for mirv_streams actions that require it (should fix i.e. wrong console colour).

Added mirv_streams action stattrackAction for baseFx based streams (which most stream types except normal currently are). Allows to fine tune the streams behaviour for the Stattrack weapon module and i.e. allows to make it invisible ( mirv_streams edit streamNameHere stattrackAction invisible ).

Updated AfxHookSource: Adjusted addresses according to 10th Nov 2015 CS:GO update. Also improved detection of m_skybox3d.scale to be more stable against CS:GO updates.

changes.change: Updated mirv_streams: Now handles error material (some fences on de_overpass have that currently).

changes.change: Fixed a mistake in code that should not affect users.

changes.change: Added mirv_campath draw support for CS:S (Counter-Strike Source) and similar Source SDK 2013 based games. Please let us know if it works in your mod too :-)

release.comments: We noticed during mirv_campath draw development, that data exported by mirv_camexport might be off (not accurate enough). If you used the data in a 3D program and can check whether or not there is a problem when syncing it to game footage, please let us know!

changes.change: Fixed LU decomposition finally, might affect very rare cases of mirv_campath draw drawing.
Bug in LU-decomposition pivotisation fixed causing bugs in line clipping. Other minor fixes.
Bug fixes mostly related to drawing.
Added mirv_campath draw. This _might_ work in other modifications than CS:GO too.
Added mirv_campath select.

Added mirv_streams officially (renamed from __mirv_streams). The system still has it's limitations, but is now in a state where it makes sense to offer it to more users. A few examples for this command will be added to the HLAE Manual hopefully.

Fixed crashes due to class pointer not being offset according to used interface in case of multiple inheritance in CAfxMesh (IMesh wrapper). Thanks to the great and mighty anthony for providing a demo with the problem.
Updated mirv_fov, when enabled it now has a higher priority and is only superseded by mirv_input camera and otherwise supersedes any other FOV setting (i.e. by the game or mirv_campath).
Updated and fixed __mirv_streams a bit. Depth streams are still heavily bugged though, especially when using Effect Detail higher than Low.
Updated __mirv_streams.

Updated __mirv_streams: Better default behaviour for matteStreams now. Also exposed lots of matteStream settings to the console (use __mirv_streams edit), i.e. worldTexturesAction, skyBoxTexturesAction, staticPropTexturesAction, cableAction, playerModelsAction, weaponModelsAction, shellModelsAction, otherModelsAction, decalTexturesAction, effectsAction, shellParticleAction, otherParticleAction, stickerAction.
Fixed mirv_input camera sometimes reacting to mouse movements when console is open.
Increased default mirv_input cfg msens to 0.1.

Updated __mirv_streams: No need to copy (2) assets anymore, HLAE will mount them in the game file system instead. For more info about testing the matte system in a early stage refer to: http://advancedfx.style-productions.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=17&t=1693 Please be aware that __mirv_streams is for testing only and subject to change.
Adjusted AfxHookSource to 30th June 2015 CS:GO update.

Added mirv_gameoverlay command for lazy people (you know who you are) that allows to disable / enable the gameoverlay. This command is useful in AfxHookSource, since the gameoverlay will be recorded with startmovie otherwise. Please note that this will not disable Steam notification sounds, but those are not recorded by startmovie anyway.
Fixed mirv_input camera mouse being trapped in window for POV demos.
Added mirv_input for input control (i.e. of camera), the command will be documented in the HLAE Manual.
Adjusted AfxHookSource to 26th May 2015 CS:GO update.
Limited usable fov (Field Of View) range (affects mirv_fov and mirv_campath) to between 1 degree to 179 degrees.

Turns out Visual Studio 2010 SP1 was not properly installed on the build computer, reinstalled it and updated or rebuild all files included in the HLAE download accordingly. Hopefully this fixes some problems on Windows 8 some users are experiencing i.e. with AfxHookSource (but maybe not).

changes.change: Added mirv_fov, allows to override the games FOV (Field Of View). The features related to mirv_campath will now pick up and interpolate the FOV. Please note that for technical reasons mirv_camexport and mirv_camimport will ignore the FOV.

release.comments: Thanks to xyanide for suggesting this feature.

changes.change: Added mirv_snd_timescale. Allows to set the timescale for the sound system independently of host_timescale. Useful for GOTV demos with startmovie and high host_framerate where host_timescale 0 is required in order to avoid lag / skipping in recoding (set mirv_snd_timescale to 1.0).
